bug.author: EMCP
bug.summary: crash error 500 when uploading a zip of PNGs
bug.description:
Describe the bug I begin to attempt to upload a zip of PNG files into the tool, and get a crash 500 error To Reproduce Steps to reproduce the behavior:
Start the project, set Object Detection config Click on Import Click and drag a .zip file made on MacOS with 160 PNGS in it See error
Expected behavior It should upload the files and let me start tagging them Screenshots <denchmark-link:https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/3691722/81860076-80e64980-9566-11ea-88fc-1ba00e130445.png></denchmark-link>
Environment (please complete the following information):
OS: MacOS Browser Chrome Version master as of todays date
Additional context Add any other context about the problem here.

comments.comment:
Hi, <denchmark-link:https://github.com/EMCP>@EMCP</denchmark-link> ! Unfortunately, this import format is not supported yet. Check available options here <denchmark-link:https://labelstud.io/guide/tasks.html#Import-formats>https://labelstud.io/guide/tasks.html#Import-formats</denchmark-link>
Specifically, if you want to import images from directory, create labeling project by using <denchmark-code>label-studio start --init --input-path /path/to/image/dir --input-format image-dir </denchmark-code>
